intro: Gagea lutea var. poliphylla, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of bell-shaped, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas. Its bulbs are small and white, and it blooms in early spring. The variety poliphylla is distinguished by its larger, more numerous flowers compared to the typical form of Gagea lutea.
